ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Cholesteatoma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Unilateral conductive hearing loss, otalgia, tympanic membrane perforation, and failure of prior medical treatment; confirmed by CT scan.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Chronic Otitis Media
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of ear infection, persistent symptoms, and tympanic membrane perforation.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and type of hearing loss.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To assess middle ear function and ear canal volume.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The right ear exhibits a mild-to-moderate conductive hearing loss in the low frequencies, rising to mild in the mid-frequencies, and sloping to a moderately severe loss in the high frequencies. Speech audiometry is consistent with pure-tone thresholds, showing excellent word recognition. Tympanometry reveals a flat (Type B) trace with a large ear canal volume in the right ear, indicating a tympanic membrane perforation. The left ear is within normal limits.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: mild-to-moderate conductive loss (250-1000 Hz), rising to mild (2000-4000 Hz), sloping to moderate/moderately severe (6000-8000 Hz). Left ear: normal thresholds.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 40 dB HL, WRS 92%. Left ear: SRT 10 dB HL, WRS 100%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Type B (flat) with large ear canal volume (6.7 mL). Left ear: Type A (normal) with normal volume (1.0 mL).

counseling_actions: Explain the conductive nature of the hearing loss.
Discuss the tympanometry findings indicating a perforation (hole) in the eardrum.
Advise on water precautions to keep the ear dry and prevent infection.
Counsel on the necessity of an ENT evaluation due to persistent symptoms and middle ear pathology.

escalation.rationale_short: Evaluation and management of cholesteatoma/middle ear pathology.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing status and surgical outcomes.
